answers.answer: POSTURAL HYPOTENSION is what that is called.  it is probably no big deal and may need no treatment.http://www.medterms.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=7671but depending on the severity, it could warrant investigation.heres some general information about it.  sometimes it is caused by certain medications:http://www.wrongdiagnosis.com/medical/postural_hypotension.htmif it is determined that he has a "bad" enough case, it can be treated with medications:http://www.wrongdiagnosis.com/o/orthostatic_hypotension/treatments.htmgood luck.

In reference to the feet, you might want to have him checked for type 1 diabetes and thyroid disorders, both of which can cause paresthesias (i.e., the tingling and falling asleep in his feet).Good luck.

question: My 15 year old son is suffering from temporary vision loss. He says that when he stands up he gets a head rush and his vision, starting with his peripherals and working in, slowly darkins. He says it only last a few seconds but he is very worried. I don't know if it has anything to do with it but he gets a tingling sensation in his hands and feet on a normal basis and they fall asleep very easy. Does anybody know what this is?
title: vision loss in both eyes
